ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: This course is an excellent way to think about psychopathology at a different level. It fits well with the coursework offered in the department about the theoretical models of psychopathology. I would recommend students take this course given its breadth and depth regarding issues that are essential for research in clinical psychology.
I would recommend it. First of all, it fulfills an APA requirement. But second of all, Professor Cannon is a good teacher.

Psych 513 is provides a great survey of the biological underpinnings of various psychopathologies. What is more, it provides a basic introduction to many biological research methodologies for those who may not have as much experience in that research domain.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This course provided me with an understanding of the field at a new level. I am more well prepared to conduct research and seek funding because of it. Understanding the biological mechanisms of psychopathology is essential for my future work.
I wrote a final paper about a topic related to my own research interests, which allowed me to explore the biological bases of processes of interest in a more in-depth way.
The final project for this class provided me with an opportunity to examine the existing biological literature related to my main research topics.
